docs.lead_paragraph: CARSWELL--Lois. The Board of Trustees, Volunteers, and Staff of Brooklyn Botanic Garden are deeply saddened by the passing of our esteemed Board Chair Emeritus, Lois Carswell. Lois began her decades-long career at BBG as a volunteer in the Auxiliary. Elected a BBG Trustee in 1985, Lois co-chaired the Conservatory Campaign, chaired and served on numerous important Board Committees, and chaired the Board of Trustees from 1989-98. For more than 40 years, she co-chaired the Garden's annual Plant Sale with her good friend and fellow Trustee Lucille Plotz. Among the many highlights of her service as Chair, Lois hosted then-current President Bill Clinton on a visit to the Garden. In recognition of her service, one of BBG's famed yellow magnolia hybrids was named for her, and today the lemon-yellow flowers of Magnolia "Lois" adorn spring gardens throughout Brooklyn and beyond. Lois was a legend in Albany having founded the statewide Coalition of Living Museums in 1980 and serving as its chair ever since; during her extraordinary leadership the CLM has brought hundreds of millions of dollars of support to operate Zoos, Botanical Gardens, Aquaria and other living museums across New York State. Lois' tremendous passion, vision, and accomplishments inspired all who knew her. She created a wide circle of friends and colleagues as part of her legacy at the Garden and will be deeply missed. We extend our heartfelt condolences to her children Anne, Alex, and Bob, and to her entire family. Frederick Bland, Board Chair Scot Medbury, President Frances Mendlow, Auxiliary President

docs.lead_paragraph: MELTON--Andrew J.,Jr., 94, former Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of Dean Witter died at his home in Tequesta, FL on October 15, 2014. Mr. Melton enjoyed a distinguished career on Wall Street. In 1946 he joined Smith Barney & Co. After 25 years with the firm he joined Dean Witter. In 1978 following the merger with Reynolds Securities Mr. Melton was named Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive of Dean Witter Reynolds. After Sears, Roebuck and Company purchased Dean Witter Reynolds in 1981, he became Chairman of Dean Witter Funds, a position he held until 1992. Raised in Bay Shore, NY, Mr. Melton graduated from Villanova University in 1942. He was commissioned an officer in the United States Marine Corps, serving in both the Pacific and Atlantic Campaigns during World War II. He was recalled to active duty in 1950 during the Korean Conflict. He was discharged from the Marine Reserves as a Major. Mr. Melton's engagement with the professional community included terms as President of the Investment Bankers Association and the Bond Club of New York. He also gave of his time and organizational talents to his local community. His positions included Commodore of the Bay Shore Yacht Club, President of the Southward Ho Country Club also in Bay Shore, N.Y. Since retirement he lived in Dorset, VT and Tequesta, FL. His greatest joy was following the activities of his very large family. The word patriarch describes his role and the respect he enjoyed. Mr. Melton was pre-deceased by his beloved wife of 55 years, Mary Ann Melton, as well as his five sisters and four brothers. He is survived by his loving companion, Barbara Fazio, and his eight children, Diana Melton Lemmen of Bremen, Germany; Andrew J. Melton III of New York, NY; Colonel Robert S. Melton, USMC (Ret) of Palm Beach Gardens, FL; Karen Melton Fox of West Palm Beach, FL; Marjorie Melton Field of Jupiter, FL; Sandra Melton Lessing of Cold Spring Harbor, NY; Michaelle Melton Stott of Riverside, CT; and, Edward L. Melton of Darien, CT. He is also survived by twenty-three grandchildren and thirteen great grandchildren. The family will receive friends at Taylor & Modeen Funeral Home, 250 Center Street, Jupiter on Friday, October 17th from 6:00pm until 8:00pm. A mass of Christian Burial will be held at St. Christopher Church, 12001 SE Federal Hwy, Hobe Sound on Saturday, October 18th at 11:30am followed with military honors conducted by U.S. Marine Corps. In lieu of flowers, contributions can be made to St. Patrick's School, 9 North Clinton Ave., Bay Shore, NY 11706. For directions or to express online condolences please visit www.taylorandmodeen.com.
